00019 #option parsing
00020 #TODO optparse is depreceated since 2.7
00021 #switch to argparse (NOT supported in 2.6)
00022 
00023 from optparse import OptionParser
00024 from sys import exit
00025 import sys
00026 import os
00027 from re import match
00028 import pickle
00029 
00030 try:
00031   import numpy
00032 except:
00033   exit("Could not import numpy modules used by cma")
00034 
00035 class state:
00036   """state class"""
00037   def __init__(self):
00038     self.state="Undefined"
00039     self.parameters=[]
00040     self.solutions=[]
00041     self.comments=""
00042 
00043   def read(self,filename):
00044     statefile = open(filename)
00045     for line in statefile:
00046       m=match("^#State = \s*(\S*)",line)
00047       if m:
00048         self.state=m.group(1)
00049       elif match("^#",line):
00050         self.comments += line 
00051       else:
00052         if len(line.strip()) == 0:
00053           continue
00054         try:
00055           li=line.split()
00056           array=numpy.array([numpy.float64(i) for i in line.split()[0:-1]])
00057         except:
00058           exit("paramter set ("+line.strip()+") contains a non-numerical value")
00059         self.parameters.append(array[0:-1])
00060         self.solutions.append(array[-1])
00061         if self.state != "Initialization" and not match("^(complete|try)$",li[-1]):
00062           exit("We can only handle parameter sets flagged with Complete or Try and we found '"+li[-1]+"'")
00063     statefile.close()
00064     self.comments=self.comments.strip()
00065     if self.state == "Undefined":
00066       exit("Could not fetch state from :"+filename)
00067     l = len(self.parameters[0])
00068     for i in range(1,len(self.parameters)):
00069       if len(self.parameters[i]) != l:
00070         exit("Length of parameter set "+str(i+1)+" mismatched previous one")
00071   def write(self,filename):
00072     statefile= open (filename,"w+")
00073     statefile.write("#State = "+self.state+"\n")
00074     statefile.write(self.comments+"\n")
00075     for i in range(len(self.parameters)):
00076       statefile.write(str(self.parameters[i]).strip('[]')+" "+str(self.solutions[i])+" pending\n")
00077     statefile.close()
00078 
00079 try:
00080   import cma
00081 except:
00082   exit("cma module could not be imported, please make sure to cma.py in your PYTHONPATH. The cma.py is available from http://www.lri.fr/~hansen/cmaes_inmatlab.html, get with 'csg_call cma get'")
00083 
00084 
00085 usage = "usage: %prog [options] statefile-in statefile-out"
00086 parser = OptionParser(usage=usage)
00087 parser.add_option("--eps", dest="eps", metavar="EPS",
00088                   help="tolerance for initialization", default=0.1)
00089 (options, args) = parser.parse_args()                  
00090 
00091 if len(args) != 2:
00092   exit("two statefile required as parameters")
00093 
00094 current_state=state()
00095 current_state.read(args[0])
00096 print "We are in State '",current_state.state, "' with parameters\n",current_state.parameters,"solutions: ",current_state.solutions
00097 
00098 if current_state.state == "Initialization":
00099   if len(current_state.parameters) != 1:
00100     exit("In Initialization step the state file should contain only one set (line)")
00101   es=cma.CMAEvolutionStrategy(current_state.parameters[0],options.eps)
00102 else:
00103   [es, X ] = pickle.load(open("cma.internal_state.cur"))
00104   if not numpy.allclose(X,current_state.parameters):
00105     exit("Parameterfile mismatches with internally saved parameters")
00106   es.tell(X,current_state.solutions)
00107 
00108 new_state=state()
00109 new_state.state="Running"
00110 new_state.parameters=es.ask()
00111 new_state.solutions=[ 0 for i in range(len(new_state.parameters))]
00112 new_state.comments=current_state.comments
00113 print "We going to State '",new_state.state, "' with parameters\n",new_state.parameters,"solutions: ",new_state.solutions
00114 new_state.write(args[1])
00115 #we need to pickle parameters as well as they are saved in a dict (string compare)
00116 #and internal precission is float64
00117 pickle.dump([es,new_state.parameters],open("cma.internal_state.new", 'w'))
